Articles.Content:
I thought it would be fun to launch a kerbal on an ejectable seat covered in serperatrons on top of a solid rocket booster.

Also I just bought the game and I really freaking love it.

Edited August 30, 2013 by mojobojo
Oh my god. I've never seen THAT happen to one!
A moment of silence for this Kerbal lost due to "scientific" experiments.
And another moment for the Kerman who is going to be launched in a few minutes at JKPS. (I have to try this xD)
I wonder how this... thing... would behave when you would get it back to the ground in one piece.
Wow...smashing them into the surface doesn't look so bad now after all...

Congratulations on discovering the "Kraken" of KSP on your first day! While Kraken attacks are much rarer now, appropriately Kerbal-engineered experiments will taunt the beast enough such that it will come out to play with your little green men.

(Kraken is the nickname given to various bugs that cause strange behavior when travelling at high speeds and in unconventional ways.)

Welcome to the forums!

No, Kraken is the name given to design failure rants where people blame the physics -__-.

That... is actually a ragdoll issue; that keeps popping up despite how long we've been using rag-doll physics in gaming ;p

Though, I too wonder what would happen if you pressed "R" and turned it back into a static object.

If you are interested I uploaded the ship. Or at least I think it is, it was in "KSP_win\saves\Engineering Disasters\Ships\VAB"

Edited July 8, 2013 by mojobojo
This is why Kerbals are better than humans... No human would volunteer to conduct such important scientific research.

No, Kraken is the name given to design failure rants where people blame the physics -__-.

That... is actually a ragdoll issue; that keeps popping up despite how long we've been using rag-doll physics in gaming ;p

Though, I too wonder what would happen if you pressed "R" and turned it back into a static object.

Ah, thanks for the clarification.

Maybe I can help here, Kraken was specifically the admittedly egregiously innappropriate name given to the torque generated by floating point errors at high speed especially when in Kerbolar orbit and when flying largish multistack asparagus craft in Kerbin orbit, (before HarvesteR implemented the "Krakensbane" fix,) which meant you could not easily pilot a ship outside Kerbin SOI. It was called Kraken because it acted like an invisible many tentacled thing was wrestling with your ship and also because CapnSkunky has a pirate joker chimp for an avatar. Be thankful as it could so easily have been Cthulhu...!

It has since passed into folklore and is often blamed for anything which goes wrong with anything, but we who have surveyed certain regions of the Kerbol system know it cannot be so because we have seen the corpse of the Kraken where it lies.
wow...um...uh...gosh...I hope he has insurance or something...
Please Disregard this. Totally got the dates wrong. Well you know, happy necroing.
You didn't break him! You sent him through a radiation belt and he became Mr. Fantastic.
